title: Application of Green Commercial Surfactant in Preparing Purely Acrylic Latex via Semi-continuous Seeded Emulsion Polymerization
reasoning: The abstract explicitly states that nonylphenol ethoxylates (NPEOs) are bioaccumulative, persistent, and produce endocrine-disrupting breakdown products, and that alkyl polyglycoside (APG) surfactants are used as a replacement. This replacement is presented in the context of preparing acrylic polymer latex, implying APG surfactants as a safer alternative to NPEOs due to the environmental and health concerns associated with NPEOs.

target_chemical_harm.rationale: The text explicitly states that NPEOs are bioaccumulative and persistent in the environment, and that nonylphenol, a breakdown product of NPEs, is an endocrine disruptor.

CHEMICAL HARM: bioaccumulative, persistent in the environment, endocrine disruptor (nonylphenol, the breakdown product)
